website_summaries.verdict: Skip the LG G Pad X 8.0 if the thought of a tablet two-year contract seems ludicrous, but if you're cool with a commitment, a $50 initial buy-in can't really be beat.
pros: The LG G Pad X 8.0 only costs $50 with a two-year AT&T service contract
It has a lightweight and portable design, sharp screen and full-size USB port
The built-in IR blaster lets you use it as a remote control
cons: The $50 price tag is half the story
You still have to pay extra for monthly cellular service

customer_reviews.title: Yet Another Awesome Product From LG!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tablet! Though I've never had T-Mobile in my life (I'm a long-time Verizon girl) I chose this item for all the great features and the low price, and since I'm using my own WiFi to connect to the internet the carrier doesn't matter. This tablet has a clear, vibrant display, expandable storage, great sound from the speaker, and it's so slim it barely weighs anything ...even with a case around it! I've had several LG products and they've never disappointed me - this one is no exception. I'm very happy with this purchase and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hiraeth

customer_reviews.title: Not even used yet and now it's not working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased May 1 2020. Turned it on tested it out. It is a gift for my Aunt so it wasnt used. I turned it on again July 3 and installed 2 apps she uses alot and allowed it to update. Now it wont stop looping the screen is flashing and it keeps turning on and off and on and off. It has just been sitting in the box in a case untouched. Front facing camera wont work now
customer_reviews.author: Tiesha CJ

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for two months and then it just died. It will not take a charge.
customer_reviews.author: ddtns@48

customer_reviews.title: A great bargain for a 4G tablet
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bargains on a full 4G-LTE tablet, this is a perfect travel tablet for anyone. Upgrades to Nougat immediately upon startup, and is very snappy in performance. The battery lasts about 3 days with moderate used (browsing, reading, messaging and some Hangouts calls), and this is with both 4G and WiFi active.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this tablet The only thing is that it glitches and turns off when it's not to 1% yet sometimes it will be 70% 35% or 20% automatically turn off sometimes out of the day but other then that I'm happy with my purchase my son love his tablet I got him
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected for a refurb
customer_reviews.text: Mine was refurbished, but has been working great. Updated to 7.0 with no issue. Plays videos really well. Picture is pretty crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Rabal

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Get the job done online, great for movies! Clear picture always!
customer_reviews.author: rodney

customer_reviews.title: Fraud
customer_reviews.text: I have received the tablet and they sent it damaged. It does not charge. Please be careful. I have lost my money but hopefully nobody falls for this.
customer_reviews.author: Aury Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Came in original box
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Came in original box. Prompt service and delivery
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Montalvan-Elkins

customer_reviews.title: A mess tbe LG fixed and made enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet for free with my LG V20 through T-Mobile. If you buy this tablet make sure you update to Android 7.0. It only has 16 GB RAM and the operating system is a hog. The Android 6.0.1 that it comes with DOES NOT have the ability to move apps to the SD card which leaves you with 10 GB storage After 7.0 update you will have around 8 GB storage but you will have the ability to move apps to your SD card. You can find apps in Amazon or Google Play by searching app 2 sd. After the update its a much more pleasant experience using this device.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Had This Tablet Since Black Friday Now, And Its Very Good, The 617 Processor Does Not Seem To Be Slow and Design Was Unique, Great For My Little 10 Yrs Old And He Was Able To Do What He Wanted To Do Pros: Camera Is Great Performance is Decent As Geekbench Scores Are: Single Core: 900, Multi Core: 2000 IPS Display Has Great Angles And Colors Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow Cons: Puny Amount Of Storage: 16GB Battery Fells Short At 3 Hrs Which Doesn't seem enough
customer_reviews.author: NotVeryAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Clunky reliability
customer_reviews.text: I've had one these for about two years. Bought it as a way to have cheap tablet 4G connectivity while out and about. Battery life is fair ..... then again - every thing about this little tablet is just fair. Pretty laggy to respond and also slow once the app is open. Very reliable so far. Gets the job if you're not in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: J. Comrie

customer_reviews.title: Pawn shop bought at $30.00
customer_reviews.text: Loving this tab. I wanted something I could use instead of my phone. You know, read the bible at night too. It has an extra side button that converts to a reading material screen. Saves battery this way. All around a great tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi & Ant Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Nice display
customer_reviews.text: Got this LTE tablet in 2016, almost 3 years now. I use it for a few hours everyday. The screen quality is great, be battery dies after 2 years, but you can easily replace it for less than 20 bucks. 16 GB internal memory (storage) is low because Android system already takes up almost half the storage. The SD card can store photos, but not apps. It gets slower with time. But for $240, it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Its nice for surfing but its terrible for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Its nice for surfing but its terrible for gaming. I got it so I could play Clash Royale and its just a terrible experience. Very laggy and skips a lot. Its nice for everyday stuff like surfing and shopping online but thats all.
customer_reviews.author: YanksOnTop

product_meta.title: T-Mobile LG G Pad X 8.0 Android Tablet (Gold), 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 4G LTE, Bluetooth 4.2
product_meta.description: The LG G Pad X V521 sports a wide 8" screen tablet that allows you to enjoy an output display in full 1200x1920 HD resolution. It runs on an Octa-Core Qualcomm Snapdragon processor on Android 6.0 Marshmallow with 2GB RAM so multi-tasking will never be an issue. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can still be expanded up to 128GB via micro SD card. This device also has a 5 MP rear camera and another 5MP front facing camera. Both can be used as camcorders and can be used for video calling as well.
feature_bullets: 100% functional item backed by Cellular Professor's 60-day warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars35 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
